name: XVerExtensionConceptMap.group.unmapped
title: Cross-Version Extension for FHIR R5:ConceptMap.group.unmapped compared to FHIR R4
description: R5 `ConceptMap.group.unmapped` maps as Equivalent to R4 `ConceptMap.group.unmapped`

element.short: What to do when there is no mapping target for the source concept and ConceptMap.group.element.noMap is not true
element.definition: What to do when there is no mapping to a target concept from the source concept and ConceptMap.group.element.noMap is not true. This provides the "default" to be applied when there is no target concept mapping specified or the expansion of ConceptMap.group.element.target.valueSet is empty.
element.comment:
R5 `ConceptMap.group.unmapped` maps as Equivalent to R4 `ConceptMap.group.unmapped`
The 'unmapped' element is ignored if a code is specified to have relationship = not-related-to or if ConceptMap.group.element.noMap = true.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Defines which action to take if there is no match for the source concept in the target system designated for the group. One of 3 actions are possible: use the unmapped source code (this is useful when doing a mapping between versions, and only a few codes have changed), use a fixed code (a default code), or alternatively, a reference to a different concept map can be provided (by canonical URL).
The fixed code to use when the mode = 'fixed'  - all unmapped codes are mapped to a single fixed code.
The display for the code. The display is only provided to help editors when editing the concept map.
element.comment: The display is ignored when processing the map.

element.short: Fixed code set when mode = fixed
element.definition: The set of fixed codes to use when the mode = 'fixed'  - all unmapped codes are mapped to each of the fixed codes.
The default relationship value to apply between the source and target concepts when the source code is unmapped and the mode is 'fixed' or 'use-source-code'.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it may indicate that there is no mapping.

element.short: canonical reference to an additional ConceptMap to use for mapping if the source concept is unmapped
element.definition: The canonical reference to an additional ConceptMap resource instance to use for mapping if this ConceptMap resource contains no matching mapping for the source concept.

element.short: What to do when there is no mapping target for the source concept and ConceptMap.group.element.noMap is not true
element.definition: What to do when there is no mapping to a target concept from the source concept and ConceptMap.group.element.noMap is not true. This provides the "default" to be applied when there is no target concept mapping specified or the expansion of ConceptMap.group.element.target.valueSet is empty.
element.comment:
R5 `ConceptMap.group.unmapped` maps as Equivalent to R4 `ConceptMap.group.unmapped`
The 'unmapped' element is ignored if a code is specified to have relationship = not-related-to or if ConceptMap.group.element.noMap = true.

element.definition: Defines which action to take if there is no match for the source concept in the target system designated for the group. One of 3 actions are possible: use the unmapped source code (this is useful when doing a mapping between versions, and only a few codes have changed), use a fixed code (a default code), or alternatively, a reference to a different concept map can be provided (by canonical URL).
The fixed code to use when the mode = 'fixed'  - all unmapped codes are mapped to a single fixed code.
The display for the code. The display is only provided to help editors when editing the concept map.
element.comment: The display is ignored when processing the map.

element.short: Fixed code set when mode = fixed
element.definition: The set of fixed codes to use when the mode = 'fixed'  - all unmapped codes are mapped to each of the fixed codes.
The default relationship value to apply between the source and target concepts when the source code is unmapped and the mode is 'fixed' or 'use-source-code'.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it may indicate that there is no mapping.

element.short: canonical reference to an additional ConceptMap to use for mapping if the source concept is unmapped
element.definition: The canonical reference to an additional ConceptMap resource instance to use for mapping if this ConceptMap resource contains no matching mapping for the source concept.
